me.aschwartz.cards

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aschwartz.cards.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Andrew Schwartz on 4/7/17.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Card(int value, me.aschwartz.cards.Card.Suit suit)
      Creates a Card instance
      This shouldn't be necessary to use on its own, and Cards should always be created through a Deck instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDisplayValue()
      Gets the display value for a given card, taking into account face cards and aces
      int getValue()
      Gets the value without any alterations for face cards or aces, for the given card
      boolean isAce()
      Determines whether or not a card is an ace.
      boolean isFace()
      Determines whether or not a card is an face card: Jack, Queen, or King.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This is the classic toString method, and it will return the DisplayValue of the card (numbers for 2-10, letters for aces, queens, etc.), as well as the Unicode symbol for the suit

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int value,
    me.aschwartz.cards.Card.Suit suit)
        Creates a Card instance
        This shouldn't be necessary to use on its own, and Cards should always be created through a Deck instance.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the card. Aces are 1, Jacks are 11, Queens are 12, Kings are 13.
        suit - An enum of suits (spades, hearts, diamonds, clubs)
        See Also:
        Deck

    • Method Detail

      • isAce

        public boolean isAce()
        Determines whether or not a card is an ace.
        Returns:
        True, if the card is an ace. False otherwise.

      • isFace

        public boolean isFace()
        Determines whether or not a card is an face card: Jack, Queen, or King. Note that this does return false if the card is an ace.
        Returns:
        True, if the card is a face card. False otherwise.

      • getDisplayValue

        public java.lang.String getDisplayValue()
        Gets the display value for a given card, taking into account face cards and aces
        Returns:
        Either the number or letter value of the card, as a String

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This is the classic toString method, and it will return the DisplayValue of the card (numbers for 2-10, letters for aces, queens, etc.), as well as the Unicode symbol for the suit
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the suit and display value of the card, such as "Q♥"

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Gets the value without any alterations for face cards or aces, for the given card
        Returns:
        The value of the card, as an int
